column4: hello, anyone here have any experience with getting wireless usb adapters to work, on ubuntu, on a computer that does not have a wireless chip ?
there is no wireless chipset .. it is a netgear usb wireless adapter.
yeah I meant on the wireless adaptor...
what model? what does lsusb say?
lsusb finds it Buss 004 Device 002: ID 0846:4260 NetGear,Inc.
yeah, i downloaded it, but i dont know how to use it. :/
should show whether ndiswrapper is installed properly if you get the help insturctions
yeah, that does nothing, the program just runs and then stops because i am give it no arguments.
you're sure its actually installed? :) ndiswrapper should return the help page
yeah, it returns the hep page.
ok then you need to get the windows drivers for the wireless adaptor and find the .inf file
